concepts.concept_name: Fundamental and derived physical quantities, SI units and dimensional formulae
Dimensional analysis: checking equations, deriving relations and converting units
Significant figures, rounding off and order of magnitude estimation
Errors in measurement: absolute, relative and percentage errors; propagation of errors in arithmetic operations

in_scope: Seven SI base units and their definitions
Dimensional formulae of common physical quantities
Applications of dimensional analysis
Rules for significant figures in calculations
Systematic and random errors
Propagation of errors in addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
Vernier callipers and screw gauge: least count and zero error
out_of_scope: Detailed history of physics beyond ICSE syllabus
Advanced error analysis using calculus-based methods
Non-SI unit systems such as CGS or FPS in depth

concepts.concept_name: Displacement, velocity and acceleration: scalar vs vector quantities, average and instantaneous values
Uniformly accelerated motion: equations of motion (v = u + at, s = ut + 1/2 at^2, v^2 = u^2 + 2as) and graphical analysis
Motion in a plane: projectile motion (range, maximum height, time of flight) and uniform circular motion
Relative velocity in one and two dimensions, river-boat and rain-man problems
Vector algebra: addition, subtraction, resolution of vectors and unit vectors in two dimensions

in_scope: Equations of motion for constant acceleration
Displacement-time, velocity-time and acceleration-time graphs
Projectile motion on level ground with standard formulae
Centripetal acceleration a = v^2/r
Vector addition using parallelogram and triangle law
Resolution of vectors into rectangular components
Relative velocity problems in 1D and 2D
out_of_scope: Non-uniform circular motion with tangential acceleration

concepts.concept_name: Newton's three laws of motion: inertia, F = ma and action-reaction pairs with free-body diagrams
Friction: static and kinetic friction coefficients, laws of friction and angle of repose
Impulse and linear momentum: conservation of momentum, collisions in one dimension
Circular motion dynamics: centripetal force, banking of roads and motion in a vertical circle
Connected bodies: pulley systems, Atwood machine and motion on inclined planes

in_scope: Drawing and solving free-body diagrams
Problems involving friction on horizontal and inclined surfaces
Impulse-momentum theorem and its numerical applications
Conservation of momentum in elastic and inelastic collisions
Banking angle formula: tan(theta) = v^2 / rg
Tension in strings and normal reaction forces
Apparent weight in a lift
out_of_scope: Non-inertial frames of reference and pseudo forces in detail
Variable mass systems such as rockets
Coriolis force and rotating reference frames

concepts.concept_name: Work done by constant and variable forces, work-energy theorem (W_net = Delta KE)
Kinetic energy (KE = 1/2 mv^2) and potential energy: gravitational PE (mgh) and elastic PE (1/2 kx^2)
Conservation of mechanical energy, conservative and non-conservative forces
Power (P = W/t = F.v), efficiency and practical applications in SI units (watt)

in_scope: Work done as dot product W = F.s.cos(theta)
Work done by gravity, spring force and friction
Numerical problems using work-energy theorem
Energy conservation in pendulums and spring-mass systems
Elastic and inelastic collisions using energy and momentum conservation
Instantaneous and average power calculations
out_of_scope: Work done using integration for arbitrary variable forces
Potential energy curves and equilibrium analysis in depth

concepts.concept_name: Centre of mass: definition, position for discrete and continuous mass distributions, motion of centre of mass
Torque (tau = r x F), angular momentum (L = I.omega) and their relation (tau = dL/dt)
Moment of inertia of standard bodies (ring, disc, rod, sphere) and parallel and perpendicular axis theorems
Rotational kinematics and dynamics: equations of angular motion and rolling without slipping
Equilibrium of rigid bodies: conditions for translational and rotational equilibrium

in_scope: Centre of mass of two-particle and multi-particle systems
Moment of inertia formulae for ring (MR^2), disc (1/2 MR^2), rod (1/12 ML^2), solid sphere (2/5 MR^2)
Application of parallel and perpendicular axis theorems
Conservation of angular momentum problems
Rolling motion on inclined planes
Conditions for equilibrium: sum of forces = 0 and sum of torques = 0
out_of_scope: Tensor representation of moment of inertia
Derivation of moment of inertia using integration for complex shapes

concepts.concept_name: Newton's law of gravitation (F = Gm1m2/r^2), gravitational constant G and principle of superposition
Acceleration due to gravity: variation with altitude (g' = g(1 - 2h/R)), depth (g' = g(1 - d/R)) and latitude
Gravitational potential energy (U = -GMm/r), escape velocity (v_e = sqrt(2gR)) and orbital velocity (v_o = sqrt(gR))
Kepler's laws: law of orbits, law of areas and law of periods (T^2 proportional to r^3) with applications to satellites

in_scope: Numerical problems on universal gravitation
Variation of g with height, depth and rotation of earth
Geostationary and polar satellite orbits
Energy of an orbiting satellite: total energy = -GMm/2r
Escape velocity from Earth and other planets
Kepler's third law calculations
out_of_scope: Elliptical orbit calculations beyond Kepler's laws

concepts.concept_name: Elasticity: stress (N/m^2), strain, Hooke's law, Young's modulus, bulk modulus and modulus of rigidity
Fluid statics: pressure, Pascal's law, hydraulic machines, Archimedes' principle and buoyancy
Fluid dynamics: streamline and turbulent flow, equation of continuity (Av = constant) and Bernoulli's theorem
Surface tension: surface energy, capillary rise (h = 2S cos(theta) / r.rho.g) and excess pressure in drops and bubbles
Viscosity: coefficient of viscosity (Pa.s), Stokes' law (F = 6.pi.eta.r.v) and terminal velocity

in_scope: Stress-strain curve: proportionality limit, elastic limit, yield point and breaking point
Numerical problems on Young's modulus and elastic potential energy
Pressure at a depth in a fluid: P = P0 + rho.g.h
Bernoulli's equation: P + 1/2 rho v^2 + rho gh = constant
Applications of Bernoulli's theorem: Venturi meter, lift on aerofoil
Capillary rise and fall in tubes
Terminal velocity derivation and numerical problems
out_of_scope: Reynolds number and turbulence theory in detail

concepts.concept_name: Thermal equilibrium, zeroth law and first law of thermodynamics (Delta U = Q - W)
Thermodynamic processes: isothermal, adiabatic (PV^gamma = constant), isobaric and isochoric with PV diagrams
Heat engines, refrigerators and Carnot cycle: efficiency (eta = 1 - T2/T1) and coefficient of performance
Second law of thermodynamics: Kelvin-Planck and Clausius statements, entropy and irreversibility
Heat transfer: thermal conduction (Q/t = kA.dT/dx), convection and radiation (Stefan's law: E = sigma.T^4)

in_scope: Work done in various thermodynamic processes from PV diagrams
Specific heat capacities Cp and Cv, relation Cp - Cv = R
Carnot engine efficiency calculations
COP of refrigerators and heat pumps
Newton's law of cooling
Thermal conductivity and steady-state heat flow through slabs
Numerical problems on first law for various processes
out_of_scope: Statistical thermodynamics and entropy at molecular level
Real gas behaviour and van der Waals equation in thermodynamic context
Radiation heat transfer with view factors

concepts.concept_name: Kinetic theory postulates, ideal gas equation (PV = nRT) and gas laws (Boyle's, Charles's, Gay-Lussac's)
Pressure of an ideal gas from kinetic theory: P = 1/3 rho v_rms^2 and RMS speed (v_rms = sqrt(3RT/M))
Kinetic energy and temperature: KE = 3/2 kT per molecule, law of equipartition of energy and degrees of freedom
Mean free path, Avogadro's number and molecular speeds: RMS, mean and most probable speed

in_scope: Derivation of pressure from kinetic theory assumptions
Relation between molecular KE and absolute temperature
Degrees of freedom for monoatomic (3), diatomic (5) and triatomic gases
Prediction of Cp/Cv ratio (gamma) using equipartition
Numerical problems on RMS, mean and most probable speeds
Ideal gas numerical problems using PV = nRT
out_of_scope: Real gas equations: van der Waals and virial equations
Transport phenomena: diffusion, viscosity and thermal conduction at molecular level

concepts.concept_name: Simple harmonic motion: displacement x = A sin(omega.t + phi), velocity, acceleration and phase
Energy in SHM: KE = 1/2 m.omega^2(A^2 - x^2), PE = 1/2 m.omega^2.x^2 and total energy = 1/2 m.omega^2.A^2
Simple pendulum (T = 2.pi.sqrt(l/g)) and spring-mass system (T = 2.pi.sqrt(m/k)): time period derivations
Damped oscillations, forced oscillations and resonance: qualitative behaviour and applications

in_scope: Defining SHM through restoring force F = -kx
Graphical representation of displacement, velocity and acceleration in SHM
Energy graphs: KE, PE and total energy vs displacement
Springs in series (1/k_eff = 1/k1 + 1/k2) and parallel (k_eff = k1 + k2)
Seconds pendulum and its length
Effect of damping on amplitude and frequency
Resonance condition and its practical examples
out_of_scope: Differential equation solutions for damped and forced oscillations

concepts.concept_name: Wave motion: transverse and longitudinal waves, wave equation y = A sin(kx - omega.t), wave speed v = f.lambda
Superposition principle, interference and standing waves: nodes, antinodes and boundary conditions
Speed of sound in gases (v = sqrt(gamma.P/rho)), effect of temperature, pressure and humidity on sound speed
Vibrations in strings and air columns: fundamental frequency and harmonics for open and closed pipes
Beats (f_beat = |f1 - f2|) and Doppler effect for sound: formulae for moving source and observer

in_scope: Progressive wave equation and identification of amplitude, wavelength, frequency and phase
Speed of transverse wave on a string: v = sqrt(T/mu)
Standing waves on strings: f_n = n/(2L) sqrt(T/mu)
Open pipe harmonics (all) and closed pipe harmonics (odd only)
Doppler effect formulae for various cases of moving source and observer
Beat frequency and its application in tuning
Reflection and refraction of waves
out_of_scope: Doppler effect for light and relativistic Doppler
Acoustic impedance and sound intensity level calculations
